clinical_study.brief_title: Prevalence of Acute Injuries in Amateur and Elite Mountain Bikers
clinical_study.official_title: Prevalence of Acute Injuries in Amateur and Elite Mountain Bikers

lead_sponsor.agency: University of Applied Sciences and Arts of Southern Switzerland

clinical_study.source: University of Applied Sciences and Arts of Southern Switzerland

brief_summary.textblock: The investigators intented to assess the prevalence of acute injuries in amateur and elite mountain bikers.

detailed_description.textblock: In order to assess the prevalence of acute injuries in amateur and elite mountain bikers a questionnaire was created in accordance to existing literature. The questionnaire was translated in several languages by bilingual people familiar with mountain biking. The questionnaire focussed on demographic data, training volume, number of races per year, number of injuries since practising mountain biking, wearing of protective gear items and accident mechanism. The survey was conducted during the Swiss Epic Mountain Bike Event in 2017. All riders were asked to voluntarily participate in the survey.

primary_outcome.measure: Prevalence of acute injuries in amateur and elite mountain bikers
primary_outcome.time_frame: During the Swiss Epic Mountain Bike Event 2017 lasting from the 11th to 16th September
primary_outcome.description: The prevalence of acute injuries in amateur and elite mountain bikers was assessed by the questionnaire used. The riders mentioned the number of acute injuries, the number of races and training volume per year and years practising mountain biking. Further, the protective gear items were asked.

secondary_outcome.measure: Differences in training and racing volume between amateur and elite mountain bikers.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During the Swiss Epic Mountain Bike Event 2017 lasting from the 11th to 16th September
secondary_outcome.description: The number of races per year was multiplied by the factor 4 to transform the number of races into training hours. Then, both values were added to get the training volume per year. To detect the difference in training volume per year between amateur and elite mountain bikers statistical tests were used.

secondary_outcome.measure: Differences in years practising mountain biking between amateur and elite mountain bikers.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During the Swiss Epic Mountain Bike Event 2017 lasting from the 11th to 16th September
secondary_outcome.description: Differences in years practising mountain biking between amateur and elite mountain bikers were detected using statistical analysis.

secondary_outcome.measure: Differences in the amount of protective gear items between amateur and elite mountain bikers.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During the Swiss Epic Mountain Bike Event 2017 lasting from the 11th to 16th September
secondary_outcome.description: Differences in the amount of protective gear items between amateur and elite mountain bikers were detected using statistical analysis.

secondary_outcome.measure: Differences in demographics, training and racing volume, years practising mountain biking, the wearing of protective gear items and number of injuries between amateur and elite mountain bikers.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During the Swiss Epic Mountain Bike Event 2017 lasting from the 11th to 16th September
secondary_outcome.description: Differences in demographics, training and racing volume, years practising mountain biking, the wearing of protective gear items and number of injuries between amateur and elite mountain bikers were detected using statistical analysis.

study_pop.textblock: The investigators included all mountain bikers participating in the Swiss Epic Mountain Bike Event in 2017, who agreed to attend in the survey.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- mountain bikers participating in the Swiss Epic Mountain Bike Event in 2017
Exclusion Criteria:
- non-participators, non-mountain bikers in the Swiss Epic Mountain Bike Event in 2017
